results.title: Metformin and troglitazone in the treatment of female infertility associated with polycystic ovarian syndrome.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Troglitazone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077288 @@@troglitazone@@@ in the treatment of @<m>DISEASE_Infertility_Female</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007247 @@@female infertility@@@ associated with @DISEASE_Polycystic_Ovary_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D011085 @@@polycystic ovarian syndrome@@@.

results.title: Insulin sensitiser agents alone and in co-treatment with r-FSH for ovulation induction in PCOS women.
results.text_hl: OBJECTIVE: The aim of this study was to compare the effectiveness of @CHEMICAL_Inositol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D007294 @@@myo-inositol@@@ (@CHEMICAL_Inositol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D007294 @@@MYO@@@) and @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, in monotherapy or in association with recombinant follicle stimulating hormone (r-FSH), in the treatment of @DISEASE_Menstruation_Disturbances @DISEASE_MESH:D008599 @@@menstrual irregularities@@@, chronic @DISEASE_Anovulation @DISEASE_MESH:D000858 @@@anovulation@@@, and @<m>DISEASE_Infertility_Female</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007247 @@@female infertility@@@ in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @DISEASE_Polycystic_Ovary_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D011085 @@@polycystic ovary syndrome@@@ (@DISEASE_Polycystic_Ovary_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D011085 @@@PCOS@@@).

citations.NLM: Raffone E, Rizzo P, Benedetto V. Insulin sensitiser agents alone and in co-treatment with r-FSH for ovulation induction in PCOS women. Gynecol Endocrinol. 2010 Apr;26(4):275-80. PMID: 20222840
citations.BibTeX: @article{20222840, title={Insulin sensitiser agents alone and in co-treatment with r-FSH for ovulation induction in PCOS women.}, author={Raffone E and Rizzo P and Benedetto V}, journal={Gynecol Endocrinol}, volume={26}, number={4}, pages={275-80}}

results.title: Prevalence, trends, and patterns of use of antidiabetic medications among pregnant women, 2001-2007.
authors: Medication Exposure in Pregnancy Risk Evaluation Program (MEPREP) Study Group
results.text_hl: Use of antidiabetic medications before pregnancy increased from 0.66% of deliveries in 2001 to 1.66% of deliveries in 2007 (P<.001) because of an increase in @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ use. Most @SPECIES_9606 @@@women@@@ using @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ before pregnancy had a diagnosis code for @DISEASE_Polycystic_Ovary_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D011085 @@@polycystic ovaries@@@ or @<m>DISEASE_Infertility_Female</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007247 @@@female infertility@@@ (67.2%), whereas only 13.6% had a diagnosis code for @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@diabetes@@@.

citations.NLM: Lawrence JM, Andrade SE, Avalos LA, Beaton SJ, Chiu VY, Davis RL, Dublin S, Pawloski PA, Raebel MA, Smith DH, Toh S, Wang JQ, Kaplan S, Amini T, Hampp C, Hammad TA, Scott PE, Cheetham TC, Medication Exposure in Pregnancy Risk Evaluation Program (MEPREP) Study Group. Prevalence, trends, and patterns of use of antidiabetic medications among pregnant women, 2001-2007. Obstet Gynecol. 2013 Jan;121(1):106-14. PMID: 23262934
